summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case, setting a trial start date of November 29, 2021, with jury selection the week of November 15, 2021. The order grants the government's motion to exclude time under the Speedy Trial Act and establishes a schedule for motions and pretrial disclosures.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case for which this order is issued, setting her trial schedule.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The United States District Judge who issued this order, setting the trial schedule and deadlines.

events.title: Jury Selection Week
events.description: The court requests that jury selection for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial occur during this week.

events.title: Trial Commencement
events.description: The date set for opening statements to the jury in the trial of Ghislaine Maxwell, pending approval from the Clerk's Office.

events.title: Deadline for Joint Letter
events.description: The parties are ordered to submit a joint letter by this date, proposing adjustments to the pretrial disclosure schedule after meeting and conferring.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The trial of Ghislaine Maxwell was scheduled to begin with opening statements on November 29, 2021.
Jury selection was to occur during the week of November 15, 2021.
Judge Alison J. Nathan granted the government's motion to exclude time under the Speedy Trial Act until November 29, 2021, citing the need for defense review of discovery and pretrial preparation.
The order establishes a deadline for motions in limine to be fully briefed four weeks before the November 29 trial date.
The parties were ordered to meet and confer and submit a joint letter by May 14, 2021, regarding the pretrial disclosure schedule.
